text.text: How do you add a membership to a patient's account in ZOLL Billing?

text: To add a membership to a patient's account in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the pencil icon next to the patient's name. 2. At the top of the page, click Edit patient details. 3. On the Account Details page, enter the membership start date. If this is a limited membership, enter the membership end date. 4. Click Save.

text.text: What does the membership card icon next to a patient's name indicate?

text: If you don't see the membership icon next to the patient's name on the claim header, check to ensure that the service date on the claim is within the starting membership date that you set. If the service date is outside the starting membership date, the membership icon will not display.

text.text: Can you describe the process for adding a membership start date and end date to a patient's account details?

text: To add a membership start date and end date to a patient's account details, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the pencil icon next to the patient's name. 2. At the top of the page, click Edit patient details. 3. On the Account Details page, enter the membership start date. If this is a limited membership, enter the membership end date. 4. Click Save.

text.text: What should you do if you don't see the membership icon next to a patient's name on the claim header?

text: If you don't see the membership icon next to a patient's name on the claim header, check to ensure that the service date on the claim is within the starting membership date that you set. If the service date is outside the starting membership date, the membership icon will not display.

text.text: What status does an incomplete claim with a patient member automatically transition to?

text: If a biller misses that a patient is a member and queues the claim up for submission, the system will not submit the claim. Instead, it automatically puts the claim in a "Suspended - Patient is a member" status.

text.text: How can you find claims with the 'Suspended - Patient is a member' status on the Dashboard?

text: To find claims with the 'Suspended - Patient is a member' status on the Dashboard, you can view the claims by status. View the status reasons for claims in each status by clicking the arrow next to the status name.

text.text: What options do you have during payment posting for a patient with a membership?

text: When the payment moves to a patient with a membership, a review page displays. You can either move the payment to the patient and suspend the claim, or adjust off the balance and close the claim. When you click the button, the claim's status changes to "Suspended - Patient is a member".

text.text: What happens to a claim when you choose to adjust off the balance and close it during payment posting for a patient member?

text: When you choose to adjust off the balance and close the claim, the claim will be closed with a status of "Closed - balance resolved".

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle claims when the payment moves to a patient with a membership?

text: When you select the "Suspend patient billing by default" option, the system automatically suspends the claim with a status of "Suspended - write-off pending". You can override this setting by clicking the edit icon next to the status on the Claim page and selecting another status.

text.text: What status is assigned to a claim after the payment moves to a patient with a membership?

text: When the payment moves to a patient with a membership, a review page displays. You can either move the payment to the patient and suspend the claim, or adjust off the balance and close the claim. When you click the button, the claim's status changes to "Suspended - Patient is a member".

text.text: How can you perform revenue adjustments on the Claim page for membership discounts?

text: To perform revenue adjustments on the Claim page for membership discounts, you can click the Credits tab and then the Adjust balance button. When the "Adjust balance" window opens, click Revenue adjustment, click the Description field, and choose a description from the list. You can then enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS.

text.text: Where can you view membership discounts in accounting periods in ZOLL Billing?

text: The membership discount displays in the Adjustment Description column in the Accounting Periods page.

text.text: Can you explain how to run the Membership Tracking report in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To run the Membership Tracking report, you can follow these steps:
1. On the Dashboard, click the Reports tab.
2. In the Report type field, select Membership Tracking.
3. In the From date field, enter the start date for the report.
4. In the To date field, enter the end date for the report.
5. Click Run report.
The report will display a list of all patients who have a membership. The report will also show the membership start date, end date, and discount amount.

text.text: What information does the Membership Tracking report provide?

text: The Membership Tracking report displays a list of all patients participating in your membership program. It includes the membership start / stop date and the number of claims opened during their membership.

text.text: How can the Membership Tracking report be useful for managing membership programs in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Membership Tracking report can be useful for managing membership programs in ZOLL Billing because it can help you to: Identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations

text.text: How membership discounts display in accounting periods

text: Membership discounts display in the Adjustment Description column.

To run the Membership Tracking report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Reports. 2. Scroll down and click Membership Tracking. 3. Enter the start and end date and then click View Report.

text.text: How to run the membership tracking report?

text: To run the Membership Tracking report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Membership Tracking. 3. Enter the report's start and end date and then click View Report.

text.text: How to add patient to a membership?

text: To add a patient to a membership, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the pencil icon next to the patient's name. 2. At the top of the page, click Edit patient details. 3. On the Account Details page, enter the membership start date.
